description: Improved water quality of the river Golema reka through environmentally friendly river bed restoration measures, and establishment of a pesticide packaging waste management system.

subproject.description:
The second phase of the ‘Restoration of Golema Reka’ project presents a logical follow-up on the activities designed and partly implemented within the first phase of the project. While the first phase focused mainly on assessment of the river’s environmental status and its underlying causes, and initiation of certain measures/activities, the second phase will to the greatest extent concentrate on implementation of the already developed measures and activities, previously prioritized by the key stakeholders. 
The second phase will mainly support the continuation of the ongoing physical interventions in the urban section of the river, but will also incorporate activities such as establishment of an efficient pesticide packaging waste management, and demonstration of ecosystem oriented river restoration in section outside the urban area.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Restoration of Golema Reka, II

subproject.description: Specific objectives of the project is mitigation of the biodegradable waste impacts (reduction of the biodegradable waste generated by agricultural activities) and improvement of the downstream water quality. With a potential for controlled treatment of the organic waste, this system aims to reduce the massive quantities of this waste by converting it into potentially valuable product(s), through establishment of sustainable biodegradable waste management system in the Prespa Region.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Biodegradable Waste Management

title: Golema Reka Programme
